English: Rock of Ages
(Yn Aght screeu Augustus Toplady eh:)

Manx: Creg dy eashyn son aym brish
English: Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Diplomatic: Creg dy eashyn son aym brish

English: Let me hide myself in Thee;

Manx: Lhig da’n ushtey as yn uill
English: Let the water and the blood,
Diplomatic: Lhig da’n ushtey as yn uill

English: From Thy riven side which flowed,
Be of sin the double cure,
Cleanse me from its guilt and power.
(Çhyndaays:)
I could pray day and night
I could with beseech with full zeal

Manx: She Oo hene shegin sauail mish
English: That which cannot improve now
Diplomatic: She Oo hene shegin sauail mish

Manx: Fegooish gioot sy theihll shoh wass
English: It is Yourself that must save me
Diplomatic: Fegoish gooit sy theill shoh wass

English: Without a gift in this world down below
Only holding to your cross
(Yn Aght screeu Augustus Toplady eh:)
Not the labour of my hands
Can fulfill Thy law's demands;
Could my zeal no respite know,
Could my tears forever flow,
All for sin could not atone;
Thou must save, and Thou alone.
Nothing in my hand I bring,
Simply to Thy cross I cling;
Naked, come to Thee for dress;
Helpless, look to Thee for grace;
Foul, I to the fountain fly;
Wash me, Saviour, or I die!

Manx: Chouds veeym tayrn yn ennal faase
English: While I draw this fleeting breath,
Diplomatic: Chouds v·em tayrn yn ennal faase

Manx: As my hooillyn jeigh ayns baase
English: When mine eyes shall close in death,
Diplomatic: As my hooilyn jeih ayns baase

Manx: Troggal er gys seihll gyn oayl
English: When I soar to worlds unknown,
Diplomatic: Throggal er gys seihll gyn oayl

Manx: Cur my-ner Oo er dty stoyl
English: See Thee on Thy judgement throne,

Manx: Creg dy eashyn son aym brisht
English: Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Diplomatic: Creg dy eashyn son aym brish

English: Let me hide myself in Thee
